Overwatch 2, once a beloved haven, now wears a false smile as it rifles through your pockets, its once-authentic essence obscured by a veil of avarice.

Back in 2016, I embraced its world and got entangled like countless others. Overwatch stood tall as my cherished shooter for ages, even during the parched times leading to the dawn of OW2.

Amid its endearing visage, enchanting characters, and peerless multiplayer landscapes, OW2 orchestrated colossal downgrades, cracking its very foundation. Let me illustrate:

#1 - Heroes Locked in the Dance of Coin

The greatest shift, a blow that hammered shut the coffin lid.

Overwatch thrives on heroes chosen and synergy woven. Each character, a distinctive asset, harmonizing or clashing with companions. Before, new heroes graced us yearly, free for all. Now OW2 expects toil or toll, Battlepass coin to unlock novelties (or Â£9 for the old guard).

Superficially, not cataclysmic. But mull over queuing for ranked skirmishes without the complete cast.

Essential gameplay locked behind gold bars in a contest of competence.

Fair fight? Picture a team with riches of choices battling a lesser-equipped squad. Pay-to-win whispers, but I'll let you muse.

#2 - The Masquerade of the Battlepass and Cosmetic Charades

I've embraced Battlepasses, yet OW2's rendition is a jest. Eighty tiers brimming, often 8 skins (a customizable gem at the end) flanked by trinkets and fillers, the norm. Trivia, titles, tokens, perhaps even dreams. Credit inclusion is a stride, but does it mend the fundamental blunder of barricading core play behind a toll?

Overwatch's essence thrives in skins sculpted by da Vinci's heirs, yet prices sting. Legendaries (beyond mere recolors) average Â£20+, quite the toll.

Once lootbox blessings flowed, earned with each level, frequent as heartbeat. Boxes bought rarely, yet the trove brimmed. Claiming lootbox woes, they unveiled a store, yet by 2019 (three years past birth) Overwatch pocketed $1 billion in loot's embrace.

Skins trickle to a parched river. Challenge grind, months for one legendary.

#3 - The PvE Mirage

PvE, distant horizon, yet Overwatch 2's vanguard. Deception's dance followed, dressed as a gameplay gale. Even post-PvE's dirge, it lingers, parcels for sale, another coin pluck.

In Awe or Defiance

For gunfight lovers, Overwatch 2's heart is hollow.

Cosmetic nomads, surrender your gold hoard.

Thrills echo, love persists, yet swindled by ravenous hands, a somber refrain.

In this cacophony, my recommendation wanes like a fading star.

Didn't play in 5 years since original game. Feels like I played an update. Still good game, Overwatch is one of my favorite games of all time. I highly recommend this game for any hero or team shooter fan. There are only two alternatives, Team Fortress 2 and Paladins. And Overwatch 2 is the best in my opinion. It lost a bit its original charme and style, but honestly, gameplay is still good as it was.

OVERWATCH WAS GREAT, I WAS AT LEVEL 173 AND WOULD OF KEPT PLAYING BUT BLIZZARD FLUSHED THE GAME I PAID FOR, ONE OF THE BEST MULTIPLAYER GAMES EVER MADE DOWN THE TOILET AND GAVE US THIS TURD.   THANKS BLIZZARD { STUPID FUGNOBS }}

Last night I had the most authentic Overwatch match, just like it was meant to be by Blizzard

So, I'm sitting in my living room and tryharding the game. It was a difficult one for our team, so I tried to do my best carrying on Soldier 76.

It could have been just one of those sweaty matches, left dusting in history, but then... Something happened.

My dog sat in front of me and dropped a huge fucking load of shit right on the floor beside a TV.

The emotions I had at the time are truly indescribable. I couldn't leave the game to clean the floor because I would've been banned from competitive matchmaking. So here I was, sweating for our team to win and smelling a real fucking stinky pile of dog shit right in front of me.

Ain't that the way this game was meant to be played all along?

As Jeff Kaplan stares at me through my computer screen, I begin to contemplate reality. What truly has substance in this realm of technology, avarice and sin? What is our future, if not a blank, hollow nothing, rife with silence and strife?
